Ukraine will be accepted, it will become visible immediately without any hints. â–â–â–â–â–â–And to create the necessary information background, the European media will begin to list all of Zelenskyâ€™s antics from 2022, at the same time, as if by chance, recalling the statements of Robert Fico.#EU #Slovakia #Ukraine@rybarSupport us

Title: ğŸ”ğŸ–¼ ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ About the corps structure of the Armed Forces of Ukrain...
Description: Forwarded From GlobalisticsğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ About the corps structure of the Armed Forces of UkraineUsing materials from colleagues, the Z Committee and the ZVI Search Engine, summarized all available information about the new corps system of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, the reforms of which were written in MilitaryMaps.â™¦ï¸The point is: in addition to various reforms like tax cuts for military-industrial complex enterprises, recruitment through recruiting, the Armed Forces of Ukraine have finally reached the finalized corps system. In 2023, before the counter-offensive, the enemy created two army corps - 9 and 10. Then they included an average of 5 brigades, and they were a strike force that was confused in attempts to advance in the Zaporozhye direction. In addition to them, there was a reserve corps, where the basis was supposed to become the 5th Brigade, but it didnâ€™t work out. She was torn to pieces, which later became commonplace. Now in the new reform there is even a ban on such practice.â—ï¸So, the corps.â–ªï¸9 AK now, judging by information from open sources, consists of three brigades: 33 and 47 Mechanized Brigades, as well as 3 Specialized Brigades.â–ªï¸10 AK - also of three connections. 116 and 118 Mechanized Infantry Brigades and the recently reformed 117th Mechanized Infantry Brigade.â–ªï¸11 AK is still the most numerous. There are ten brigades in it. This is due to the fact that it was a reserve corps previously, and all brigades that were sent to full strength were assigned to it.â–ªï¸12 AK is a new corps. There is not even information about who will enter it. And it seems that some of the compounds 11 AK will become part of it. This will be logical for the operational recruitment of 12 AK.â—ï¸In addition to this, there is the 30th Marine Corps. Its composition has also recently undergone changes. The 150th Mechanized Infantry Brigade became the 40th separate coastal defense brigade (OBrBO). In addition, it has 39 OBrBO, which will most likely be created on the basis of 124 OBr TerO. The 7th Corps of the DShV includes all airmobile and air assault units. Almost all of them are fighting in various sectors, which is why they have a huge turnover.â™¦ï¸In general, the structure of the Armed Forces of Ukraine has changed radically. If we evaluate it in terms of combat capabilities, the most important improvement is the creation of separate control lines that are independent of each other. That is, each corps, or rather the command, can make decisions independently. This simplifies both replenishment, manning, and combat operations, since they are not waiting for a decision from Kyiv. In conflicts of such intensity, this is a key factor. Individual battalions of UAVs and BECs deserve special attention. Priority acquisition, large funding and PR are important changes in the context of the growing importance of these weapons. #Ukraine Globalistics - subscribe to the channel

Title: ğŸ‡°ğŸ‡¿âš›ï¸ Why does Kazakhstan need three nuclear power plants? Presi...
Description: ğŸ‡°ğŸ‡¿âš›ï¸ Why does Kazakhstan need three nuclear power plants? President of Kazakhstan Kassym-Jomart Tokayev said that it is necessary to -accelerate- with the construction of nuclear power plants, and also repeated his recent thesis about the need to -build two large plants, possibly three. Three nuclear power plants were discussed even before the referendum: the head of the Ministry of Energy of the Republic of Kazakhstan Almasadam Satkaliev voiced this need and even named possible sites. Nuclear power plants are convenient for the Republic of Kazakhstan because they can close the generation gap, without undermining declarations of striving for carbon neutrality. â–â–â–â–â–â–One can even assume that the authorities initially considered such a scenario, but decided not to escalate the situation right off the bat and first achieve the populationâ€™s consent in principle for construction. In this case, the construction of one or more nuclear power plants would become a technical issue. At the same time, it seems that Astana has already resolved the issue with the contractor. And then Tokayevâ€™s statement is a sweetened pill for those counterparties who were left without a contract. It is no coincidence that the president mentioned in his interview (in this order): Rosatom, Chinese companies and Western ones, thus setting priorities. #Kazakhstan #CentralAsia@rybarSupport usKazakhstan's main news - Tengrinews.kzAn extensive interview with President Tokayev has been published. Title: â“ğŸ’¸ Why support us? Against the backdrop of urgent collections fo...
Description: â“ğŸ’¸ Why support us? Against the backdrop of urgent collections for the needs of the units, the requests of the Rybar team to neglect a cup of coffee and donate the conditional 150 rubles for Russian analytics look ridiculous from the point of view of many. Title: ğŸ” #Summary for the morning of January 11, 2025 â–ªï¸ At night, the ...
Description: Forwarded From Two Majors#Summary for the morning of January 11, 2025â–ªï¸ At night, the enemy attacked our regions with aircraft-type UAVs. In the Belgorod region, several enemy drones were shot down over the Belgorod district; as a result of falling debris in the village of Maisky, windows were broken in private households and roofs were damaged. At least 15 UAVs were shot down at night in the Voronezh region. The Krasnodar region was subjected to a massive drone attack. Local residents reported the sound of explosions over Anapa and in Novorossiysk, where a fire started after one of the explosions. In Kotovsk, Tambov region, two residential buildings were damaged and there were casualties. Drones were also reported from the Kursk, Saratov and Lipetsk regions, Sevastopol, Kerch and Taman. â–ªï¸ In the Kursk region, the enemy, taking advantage of poor weather conditions with limited visibility, launched 11 unsuccessful counterattacks on different sections of the front in the Sudzhansky border area. Our troops have completed clearing out enemy strongholds between Guevo and Kurilovka, and are advancing with stubborn battles into the forest belts of the Sudzhansky district. Fierce fighting continues in Makhnovka and Cherkasskaya Porechnaya, where the enemy is transferring more and more units.â–ªï¸ In Toretsk (Dzerzhinsk), our troops, with heavy fighting, are developing an offensive against the remaining enemy positions in the mines and urban development on the outskirts of the city. The waste heaps at mine No. 10 have been taken. The months-long assault on the city is gradually coming to an end, but it is too early to talk about the complete capture of the city; the battle continues. The enemy clings to positions, conducts an organized defense, strikes with many drones.â–ªï¸ In the Pokrovsky direction, the Russian Armed Forces have not yet begun to storm the city itself, trying to cut off the enemyâ€™s logistics, moving from the southwest (Volkovo-Solyonoe line). Although there are a couple of kilometers left to Pokrovsk itself (Krasnoarmeysk)â–ªï¸ North-west of the liberated Kurakhovo, the Russian Armed Forces are advancing from the settlement. Shevchenko towards Andreevka, leveling the front at Slavyanka. â–ªï¸ In the direction of Velikaya (Bolshaya) Novoselka, fighting continues around nearby settlements. It is necessary to completely block the enemy's possibility of delivery; a pocket has been formed again, in which enemy forces remain.â–ªï¸In the Belgorod region, near the village of Yasnye Zori, a kamikaze drone attacked a moving car, two men were wounded. On the Nikolskoye-Yasnye Zori highway section, another drone hit a regular bus, injuring the driver. â–ªï¸In the DPR, the enemy fired at a village with a 122 mm MLRS. Svetlodarsk, used high-explosive JROF-M missiles with a range increased to 40.2 km and increased striking power, presumably from the area of â€‹â€‹the settlement. Konstantinovka (Dzerzhinsky direction). Three women were killed, a girl born in 2008 was seriously injured, and six civilians were wounded. Donetsk was shelled from the M142 HIMARS (M-270) MLRS, four civilians were wounded. The summary was compiled by: Two majorsTelegramFacts of war crimes of UkraineğŸ“¸ Consequences of an armed attack n.p. Svetlodarsk (city of Debaltsevo) at 07:20 01/10/2025â—ï¸Specialists from the Department for Documenting War Crimes of Ukraine confirmed the fact of shelling of the village. Svetlodarsk, from an MLRS with a caliber of 122 mm, and also clarified...

Title: ğŸ”ğŸ–¼ âš¡ï¸New NATO exercises on the eastern flank. Large-scale deplo...
Description: Forwarded From Two Majorsâš¡ï¸New NATO exercises on the eastern flank. Large-scale deployment of a response force led by the NATO Rapid Deployment Corps and supported by 10 allies. NATO will conduct a large-scale exercise called Steadfast Dart in Romania, Bulgaria and Greece from 13 January to 26 February. The purpose of the exercise: the first large-scale deployment of the NATO Rapid Reaction Force (ARF) ). Their purpose is to test the capabilities of rapid deployment, as well as the interaction between participating and host countries. The ARF is a strategic, highly mobile, multi-role force. It brings together multi-role forces from across the Alliance to achieve objectives in a shorter time frame than previously possible. The exercise will demonstrate NATO's ability to quickly deploy forces to strengthen its eastern flank. The transfer of reinforcements will take place during a simulation of a conflict with an enemy of almost equal strength. It must demonstrate the ability of NATO's response force to conduct complex combat operations in a theater spanning thousands of kilometers under any conditions,- NATO said in a statement. Although the exercises are taking place in southern Europe, the Alliance emphasizes that the main goal of these maneuvers is to improve operations near Russian borders. The exercises will involve 10 thousand military personnel, various types of troops, including ground forces, navy, aviation and special forces units . ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§Great Britain will be one of the largest participants in the exercises, sending 2.6 thousand military personnel and 730 units of equipment.âœ¨It would seem that 10 thousand military personnel is not so much. However, NATO exercise standards test the ability to quickly deploy a contingent hosting the main force. That is, it is not entire formations from different countries that are participating, but the main backbone, which NATO members are able to quickly build up with meat. It is important that during the maneuvers the ability of logistics on the eastern flank of the Alliance is tested (and they are improving logistics very actively after the start of the Northern Military District). In general, all this is called military preparations, which European countries are doing more and more diligently. Two majors

Title: ğŸ‡¯ğŸ‡µ What will Japan's military budget go towards in 2025? At the...
Description: ğŸ‡¯ğŸ‡µ What will Japan's military budget be used for in 2025? At the end of December last year, the Japanese government, led by Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba, approved the country's new defense budget, which is already a record for the 13th time. They are going to allocate about $55 billion for security needs. ğŸ“ŒThe money will go to various items of expenses. These include the development and production of domestic long-range missiles for counterattacking enemy military targets. In addition, finances will be spent on creating a satellite constellation necessary for detecting targets and monitoring them. It seems it's no coincidence that a unit of the US Space Force was stationed in Japan last year. ğŸ”»Approximately three billion has been allocated to improve the conditions of service of the Japanese military. This also includes an increase in salary. Such expenses are necessary because in Japan there is a certain shortage of personnel in the Self-Defense Forces. Here, by the way, it is worth considering that the approval of the budget by Ishibaâ€™s cabinet does not mean that it will be adopted in the countryâ€™s parliament. According to the results of last year's elections, the ruling party lost its majority in the legislative body, which means the opposition can still put a spoke in the wheels of the government. We will be able to find out the final defense spending later this year. #Japan@rybar together with @awaken_dragonSupport usKyodo News+Japan defense budget hits record 8.7 tril. yen amid regional threatsJapan's defense budget grew to a record 8.70 trillion yen ($55 billion) for fiscal 2025, the government says, as the country continues to enhance its capabilities to address regional threats amid China's rapid military buildup and North Korea's growing tiesâ€¦

Title: ğŸ” #Summary for the morning of January 10, 2025 â–ªï¸ At night, our ...
Description: Forwarded From Two Majors#Summary for the morning of January 10, 2025â–ªï¸ At night, our air defense repelled UAV raids on Russian regions. In the Rostov region, at least 16 drones were destroyed and suppressed by electronic warfare in the morning. In the Myasnikovsky district in the village of Chaltyr, a fire broke out in a private house and cars caught fire. In the village of Crimea there is a fire at a production plant. In the Kryukov village of the Kuybyshevsky district, several buildings were damaged due to the fall of a drone. Drones were also destroyed in the suburbs of Voronezh, and private houses were damaged. At least three UAVs were shot down over the Bryansk region. The channels also reported on the work of air defense in the Krasnodar region.â–ªï¸ Information on the network about events in the Kursk region is often either ahead of the events, or is deliberately not covered for obvious reasons; there are heavy oncoming battles. It is guaranteed that we can only talk about battles near specific settlements due to the high intensity of hostilities. The Russian Armed Forces retain the initiative, the group of troops - North - reports the encirclement of the enemy at strong points between Guevo and Kurilovka. Our assault troops are advancing with persistent fighting in the forest belts of the Sudzhansky border region, in the vicinity of the settlements of Darino, Sverdlikovo, Orlovka, Nikolaevka, Makhnovka and Cherkasskoye Porechnoye. Five Ukrainian Armed Forces servicemen and a mercenary from Colombia were captured. Over the past 24 hours, the enemy has transferred units from several different territorial defense brigades from Kramatorsk and a special forces group from the Dnepropetrovsk region. â–ªï¸ Our bridgehead on the right bank of the river is expanding north of Kupyansk. Oskol in the village Dvurechnaya. Our troops advanced in the village itself and its environs. â–ªï¸ In Toretsk (Dzerzhinsk), heavy fighting continues in the north and west of the city, the enemy is pushed back to the outskirts, while maintaining control over important strongholds.â–ªï¸ In the Pokrovsky (Krasnoarmeysky) direction, our troops advanced south of the settlement. Baranovka, in the Vozdvizhenka area in the direction of the Pokrovsk - Konstantinovka highway. There is an offensive through the settlement. Peschanoye and to the west of Volkovo. South of Pokrovsk, the Russian Armed Forces are pushing through the enemyâ€™s defenses in the area of â€‹â€‹the settlement. Slavyanka Petropavlovka. The enemy's resources state that they expect the transfer of our reserves to maintain a high tempo of combat operations, although this may be an inept attempt to justify the growing number of tactical crises of the Ukrainian Armed Forces in this sector of the front.â–ªï¸ In the Zaporozhye region, as a result of an enemy artillery strike on Kamenka-Dneprovskaya, two women died in 1940 and Born 1965 The artillery attack was accompanied by strikes from enemy drones.â–ªï¸ In the Kherson region, Podo-Kalinovka, Abrikosovka, Velikiye Kopani and Novaya Mayachka were hit by the Ukrainian Armed Forces. Two people were killed and six people were injured.â–ªï¸ In the Belgorod region, in the Shebekinsky district in the village of Murom, a UAV attacked a private house, a man was wounded. In the village Borisovka detonated an FPV drone of the Ukrainian Armed Forces. In Nikolskoye, Belgorod district, the roof of a high-rise building was broken and windows in 3 apartments were broken. In the village of Oktyabrsky, Belgorod district, a drone attacked the parking lot of a commercial facility. In the Volokonovsky district in the village of Konovalovo, a private house was damaged by an enemy FPV. In the Belgorod region, the village of Chaiki was attacked by several FPV drones. In Malinovka, Belgorod district, a power line was damaged. â–ªï¸ In the DPR in Gorlovka, a woman born in 1965 was wounded as a result of an artillery strike. The summary was compiled by: Two majors Telegram Two majors Kursk region. Generalized report for the evening Berdin Farm, in the direction of which the enemy threw his columns with equipment and personnel, has been cleared.N.p. Kruglenkoye is firmly controlled by our troops (updated: disputed from the ground). To the westâ€¦

Title: ğŸ¬ â—ï¸ğŸŒğŸ Worsening of the situation in the Middle East: events o...
Description: â—ï¸ğŸŒğŸ Worsening of the situation in the Middle East: events of week 3 - January 9, 2024â–ªï¸The Yemeni movement -Ansarallah- attempted to attack Israeli territory with a hypersonic missile -Palestine-2-. The target was the Orot Rabin thermal power plant in Hadera, but the ammunition was intercepted over the Mediterranean Sea.â–ªï¸In response, the American and British Air Forces bombed Houthi positions in Yemen. Suspected missile launch sites in the vicinity of the capital, Saada, were hit.â–ªï¸Clashes continue in Syria between militants who seized power and supporters of the overthrown government. In Latakia, partisans attacked a patrol of Uyghur jihadists; among those eliminated was a commander of Turkish origin.â–ªï¸In the north of the country, fighting between Kurdish forces and pro-Turkish formations intensified somewhat. The Syrian National Army factions managed to advance south of Maskana, but attacks at the Tishrin Dam were unsuccessful.â–ªï¸In parallel, Turkish troops launched artillery and air strikes on the border areas. At the same time, there has not yet been a ground offensive by the Turkish Armed Forces to capture Ain al-Arab and its countryside.â–ªï¸The situation on the border with Lebanon has worsened, where firefights broke out between unknown militants and Lebanese troops. After the cessation of the clashes, the Lebanese Armed Forces and the HTS security service sent reinforcements to the border villages.â–ªï¸In the south of the country, Israeli troops maintained a presence in the Syrian province of Quneitra. Soldiers of the Ha-Arim brigade reported the discovery of caches of weapons in the area of â€‹â€‹occupied Mount Hermon. Taking advantage of the instability in the country, the Islamic State terrorists expanded their capabilities. In the city of As-Sanamain in Daraa province, jihadist cells attacked the facilities of the new administration.#video #digest #map #Yemen #Syria #Iraq@rybarSupport us Video is too big

Title: ğŸ–¼ ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ Chronicle of a special military operation for January...
Description: ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ Chronicle of a special military operation on January 9, 2025. Russian troops launched a series of attacks on Ukrainian Armed Forces facilities in the border zone and rear regions of the so-called. Ukraine. The enemy launched several drones across the territory of the Krasnodar Territory, most of them were shot down by air defense systems on duty. In the Kursk region, the clearing of the environs of Berdin from the enemy was confirmed; it also became known about the control of the Russian Armed Forces over Agronom and advance in the direction of Nikolskoye. In the Liman direction, Russian troops advanced to the western border of the LPR, knocking out the enemy from positions in forest belts near Makeyevka. In the Pokrovsky direction, fighters of the Russian Armed Forces are pushing through the positions of the Ukrainian Armed Forces along the entire front line, clearing the landings in anticipation of the possible start of an offensive in the direction of Pokrovsk and Mirnograd. In the Kurakhovsky direction, fighting continues at the Yasenovoye - Slavyanka line and south of Kurakhovo, in both areas the fighters of the Russian Armed Forces are enjoying success. ğŸ”»A detailed analytical report on events in the Special Military Operation zone is available on our closed channel @rybar_plus_bot High-resolution maps: Situation in the Special Military Operation zone (ru; en) Kursk direction: (ru; en) Pokrovsky direction (ru; en)â­ï¸ Online -maps are available by subscription to map.rybar.ru#digest #report #map #Krasnodar #Kurakhovo #Kursk #Liman #Pokrovsk #Russia #Ukraine@rybarSupport us

Description: ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡±ğŸ‡µğŸ‡¸ Aggravation in the Israeli-Palestinian conflict zone chronicle of events for January 8-9, 2025 Israeli troops launched another series of attacks on parts of the Gaza Strip controlled by Hamas. The capital of the Palestinian enclave, Nuseirat, and the surrounding area of â€‹â€‹Khan Yunis came under the most concentrated fire. At the same time, IDF operations continue in the north of the enclave, where this time Palestinian forces were active: they carried out successful ambushes in Beit Lahia and Jabaliya, killing at least three Israelis. In the West Bank, Israeli security forces conducted a series of raids in more than ten settlements: over the past two days, more than 60 local residents were detained. The largest clashes occurred in Jenin and Tulkarm. On the Lebanese-Israeli border, the situation has not undergone significant changes: the Israelis periodically strike at identified targets in the south of Lebanon, while fighters from the Arab Republic are gradually entering some settlements. ğŸ”»A detailed analytical report on events in the Israeli-Palestinian conflict zone is available on our closed channel @rybar_plus_bot High resolution map English versionâ­ï¸ Online maps are available by subscription to map.rybar.ru#digest #report #map #Israel #Palestine@rybarSupport us

Title: ğŸ–¼ ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ Liman direction: expansion of the zone of control of ...
Description: ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ Liman direction: expansion of the zone of control of the Russian Armed Forces on the right bank of the Zherebets River. Over the past two weeks, the front section has clearly revived, Russian troops have advanced to the western border of the LPR. Thanks to footage from Makeyevka, it was possible to establish that fighters of the Russian Armed Forces expanded the zone of control, clearing several forest belts on the right bank of the Zherebets River. To the south, work is underway to eliminate the bridgehead of the Armed Forces of Ukraine in the vicinity of the recently liberated Ivanovka, but information about the breakthrough of the defense of the Armed Forces in the direction of Kolodezy cannot yet be confirmed. The development of the success of the Russian Armed Forces in the direction of Yampolovka and Torskoye will make it possible to free the entire left bank from the presence of the enemy and begin the assault on Zarechny, from where the road to Liman opens. If you have additions to the situation, you want us to highlight the successes of your unit - you can always write to us in the feedback bot @rybar_feedback_botâ­ï¸ Online maps are available by subscription to map.rybar.ru#Liman #Russia #Terns # Ukraine@rybarSupport us

Title: ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡¿ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡² Aliyev is creating reasons for a new war against Armenia...
Description: ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡¿ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡² Aliyev creates reasons for a new war against Armenia. The New Year in Baku begins with yet another claims against Yerevan. Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev said that Armenia is a threat to the South Caucasus. Aliyev demanded that France and other countries stop arming Armenia: break military contracts and return the supplied weapons. Another condition is the opening of the so-called. Zangezur corridor through the south of Armenia, which will connect Azerbaijan and Turkey. To the stated conditions, Aliyev added changes to the Constitution of Armenia and the abolition of the OSCE Minsk Group on the settlement of the Karabakh conflict. ğŸ“ŒAs we wrote, the peace process between Azerbaijan and Armenia has predictably reached a dead end, despite the demonstrative optimism promoted by the now retiring US presidential administration. The deadlock in the situation lies in the fact that Yerevan is already making concessions, including on amending the Constitution. Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan even spoke about his readiness to open a message via the so-called. Zangezur corridor, but with respect for the sovereign rights of Armenia. ğŸ”»Since Baku still accuses Armenia of sabotaging the opening of communications in the south, the main claim of the Azerbaijanis is aimed at the sovereign rights of Armenians to their territory. To achieve this, the Azerbaijani media are promoting the image of an -aggressive- and -revanchist- Armenia, which does not correspond to reality. â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â—ï¸All this once again suggests that Azerbaijan is creating a reason for another military aggression, which may happen in the near future and its target will be the Syunik region. The state of the Armenian Armed Forces raises big questions: French and Indian-made weapons do not create offensive potential and it is unclear to what extent they can even provide defense. #Azerbaijan #Armenia @rybarSupport usInterfaxAliyev called Armenia a source of threat to the South CaucasusPresident of Azerbaijan Ilham Aliyev said that Armenia is a source of threat to the South Caucasus.

Title: ğŸ‡¹ğŸ‡©ğŸ–‡ What happened in Chad? On the evening of January 8, multip...
Description: ğŸ‡¹ğŸ‡©ğŸ–‡ What happened in Chad? On the evening of January 8, multiple sources reported shootings near the Presidential Palace in N'Djamena, the capital of Chad. There were different rumors about the incident - from a coup attempt to an attack by almost defeated Boko Haram terrorists. The latter story was even initially supported by the Chadian authorities, to whom political strategists proposed to hush up the incident in this way. Later, officials confirmed that the attackers did not belong to terrorist groups. It was especially noted that they did not have firearms, and they got to the Palace by public transport.â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â“So what really happened? The incident turned out to be an ordinary skirmish between representatives of tribes who met - not in that place... There has long been a saying among Chadians that you should not look at the president for more than half a minute, and in this case they started a fight right in the center of the capital. To separate them, the police and the Palace guards opened warning fire, which is why some participants in the brawl attacked them . During the clash, according to media reports, 18 attackers and 1 policeman were killed. The real number of victims is somewhat lower.â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â—ï¸But the main thing in this story is the reaction of the French media. The largest media agencies AFP and RFI reported the shooting in N'Djamena half an hour after the incident and cited rumors of a coup attempt or terrorist attack .And this is due to the fact that on the same day the first group flew from Nâ€™Djamena to the mainland French military personnel, which was a reputational blow for France. In addition, in the morning Debi the Younger received the head of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the People's Republic of China.â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–ğŸ”»Thus, the Western media inflated the molehill out of a molehill and turned a domestic skirmish almost into a military coup against the anti-French president . Most likely, they planned to increase the degree of escalation and try to ignite a civil conflict, but, as we see, this was not possible.#Africa #Chad #France #mediatechnology@rybarSupport usBurkina24.com - ActualitÃ© du Burkina Faso 24h/24Tentative de dÃ©stabilization au Tchad : La version des faits du gouvernement qui Ã©voque 18 morts cÃ´tÃ© assaillants et un mort du...ActualitÃ© - Tentative de dÃ©stabilization au Tchad : La version des faits du gouvernement qui Ã©voque 18 morts cÃ´tÃ© assaillants et un mort du cÃ´tÃ© des gardes de sÃ©curitÃ© prÃ©sidentielle

Title: ğŸ”ğŸ–¼ ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§ Britain is creating new stealth boats to attack Russia ...
Description: Forwarded From Two MajorsğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§ Britain is creating new low-profile boats to attack Russia from the sea. On January 22, the UK Ministry of Defense will hold a conference in London on the new COOKSON project to develop a universal, fast and stealth maritime system intended for operations in Ukraine. The project involves the creation of a small fast attack boat equipped with a modular payload and capable of operating in difficult conditions. Options for boats and completely without a crew are being considered. The Ministry outlined the desired characteristics of COOKSON:â–ªï¸Maximum speed: from 40 knotsâ–ªï¸Range: 800 nautical miles with a full loadâ–ªï¸Autonomy: at least 72 hoursâ–ªï¸Unobtrusive silhouetteâ–ªï¸High noise immunityâ–ªï¸Ability to carry several weapon modules with a range at once 30-100 km.â–ªï¸Availability of air defense systems The system should be able to quickly be supplied to Ukraine by land on a trailer about 6-12 meters long. Each long-range weapon will carry an 80-kilogram high-explosive warhead. The primary targets are unprotected land areas, the secondary targets are surface ships. The project requirements include scalability and production time with a target of 2-3 ships in the first months with 20 weapon modules. The UK plans to begin purchasing the first 10 COOKSON systems, along with hundreds of weapon modules, in the first quarter of 2025.âœ¨ It is noteworthy that such systems are being directly prepared specifically for British missions in the Black Sea under the guise of Ukrainian activity. They act systematically: first they test the MBECs, making the operation of the fleet of large warships as difficult as possible, then they modernize the MBECs in order to reduce the efficiency of our aviation. Now we have moved on to the next stage - they will try to attack from the sea the coastal strip and objects in the rear, where the air defense density is traditionally lower. An important requirement for the system is the ability to send mission information remotely, and target detection, identification and planning can be performed by third parties. Two majors

Title: ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¾ğŸ´ Again about the issues of the Russian presence in Syri...
Description: ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¾ğŸ´ Again about the issues of the Russian presence in Syria. Here, the next questions have surfaced regarding the presence of the Russian contingent in -New Syria-: for several days now, the cargo ship -Sparta- has not been able to enter the port of Tartus, where the 720th point is located materially - technical support (720 PMTO) of the Russian Navy. Now the Russian ship is standing on external roadstead in the Mediterranean, awaiting further decisions. The official reason for the delay has not yet been named; different versions are being considered - from internal logistics and technical problems to the refusal of the new authorities to provide permission to enter the port.â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–ğŸ”»The second option is most likely. The country is now headed by functionaries of the terrorist organization Hayat Tahrir al-Sham (HTS) and structures loyal to it. Of course, relations with those who were bombed by the Russian Aerospace Forces only yesterday will be strained, to put it mildly. The essence does not change - we face a new reality. There are no longer those with whom first the Soviet and then the Russian authorities signed agreements, according to which our troops were stationed at the Khmeimim airbase and in Tartus. There were no agreements on this issue with HTS or anyone else. However, new realities also arose for the militants of the new Syrian government. Now it will no longer be possible, as before, to play the role of -irreconcilable Mujahideen-, who under no circumstances collude with the enemy. This is no longer a small Idlib that can be given under the wing of Turkey. â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–ğŸ“Œ If yesterdayâ€™s moderate opposition could safely call Russia an occupier, today it is the presence of Russian naval and air bases that will allow balancing the political influence of friendly countries and internal competitors from among the most radical factions. And judging by the presence of the Russian embassies on the territory of the country, the absence of public diplomatic attacks on the Russian Federation and statements by the leader of HTS himself about the existence of strategic interests between the two countries, Damascus understands this fact. #Russia #Syria #terrorism@rybarSupport us

Title: ğŸ” #Summary for the morning of January 9, 2025 â–ªï¸ In the Kursk re...
Description: Forwarded From Two Majors #Summary for the morning of January 9, 2025â–ªï¸ In the Kursk region, the North group of troops is fighting stubbornly, knocking out the enemy from strongholds between Guevo and Kurilovka, as well as in the forest belts of the Sudzhansky border area. There are battles in the area of â€‹â€‹the settlement. Staraya Sorochina, Makhnovka and Bondarevka. During the day, the arrival of over 350 enemy personnel in the region was recorded, including from special operations forces and 132 separate reconnaissance battalions. Data are being received about the concentration of the enemy in the area of â€‹â€‹the settlement. Cellars and the presence of reserves at the Armed Forces of Ukraine in the Sumy region.â–ªï¸ In the Krasnolimansky direction there are battles in the area of â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹Ivanovka and Ternov. â–ªï¸ From the Pokrovsky direction, data is received that east of the city, movement to the north towards the Pokrovsk-Konstantinovka highway through Vozdvizhenka and nearby villages has become effective. â–ªï¸ West of Kurakhovo, our troops liberated the village. Shevchenko and are expanding the zone of control around him, aggravating the position of the Ukrainian Armed Forces in the pocket to the south. There are battles for the settlement. Dachnoe.â–ªï¸ In the Velikonovoselkovsky direction, the Russian Armed Forces advanced along the forest belt northeast of the settlement. Rivnopol and to the west of the settlement. Not boring. The fighting is going on in the direction of the Gulyaypole - Velikaya Novoselka highway and in the area of â€‹â€‹the settlement. New Komar.â–ªï¸ Yesterday from the Zaporozhye region it was reported that the enemy carried out a guided missile attack on the port of Berdyansk. There were no casualties. The fires that formed as a result of the arrival have been extinguished. -The strike was aimed at one of the empty oil product storage tanks,- said the regional governor.â–ªï¸ In the evening, an air defense system went off over Belgorod and the Belgorod region - several enemy drones were shot down, and the houses of civilians were damaged. During the day, in the village of Murom, Shebekinsky District, a drone detonated near a private household. In the Krasnoyaruzhsky district, power lines were damaged as a result of shelling. The village of Chaiki, Belgorod region, was attacked by two drones. As a result of the fall of drones in the village of Razumnoye, a power line was damaged. In the village of Voznesenovka, Shebekinsky district, as a result of a shell strike in one private house, windows were broken. The summary was: Two majors Telegram Two majors Belgorod region, governor: 6 settlements of our region were attacked by the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Preliminarily, none of the residents were injured. In the village of Voznesenovka, Shebekinsky District, as a result of a shell strike, a private house was knocked out...

Title: ğŸ–¼ ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ Chronicle of a special military operation for January...
Description: ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ Chronicle of a special military operation on January 7-8, 2025. Russian troops launched a series of targeted strikes on targets in the territory controlled by the Ukrainian Armed Forces. One of the targets in occupied Zaporozhye was Motor Sich, where a fire broke out. Ukrainian formations launched several dozen UAVs across the rear regions of Russia. According to the Russian Ministry of Defense, 32 were shot down, and a fuel storage facility in the Saratov region was damaged. In the Kursk region, the enemy was driven out of several settlements, Russian troops are advancing in the area of â€‹â€‹Malaya Loknya, Russky Porechny and Pogrebkov. In the Kupyansko-Svatovsky direction, the enemy attacked in the Kotlyarka area, and Russian troops advanced between Zagryzovo and Lozovaya. In the Aleksandro-Kalinovsky direction they continue heavy fighting within the borders of Dzerzhinsk, Russian attack aircraft are cutting their way to the western outskirts of the city. In the Pokrovsky direction, local advances of the Russian Armed Forces are observed in several areas, as well as a breakthrough at Vozdvizhenka, and heavy fighting is taking place. In the Kurakhovo direction, the enemy was also driven out of several fairly large strongholds in the fields south and southwest of Kurakhovo. And in the Vremevsky direction the noose around Bolshaya Novoselka is tightening. Russian attack aircraft occupied the surrounding fields and reached the outskirts of the village and neighboring Neskuchny.ğŸ”»A detailed analytical report on the events in the Special Military Operation zone is available on our closed channel @rybar_plus_bot High-resolution maps: Situation in the special military operation zone (ru; en)Aleksandro-Kalinovskoye direction: (ru; en) Kurakhovskoe direction (ru; en) Vremevskoe direction (ru; en)â­ï¸ Online maps are available by subscription to map.rybar.ru#digest #Dzerzhinsk #report #Zaporozhye #map #Kupyansk #Kurakhovo #Kursk #Pokrovsk #Russia #Ukraine@rybarSupport us

Title: ğŸ¬ğŸ–¼ ğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ Where are the American self-propelled guns being ta...
Description: ğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ Where are the American self-propelled guns from Slovenia being taken? Last night in the port of Koper, our subscribers from Slovenia captured the movement of a large convoy of weapons in the direction of the Slovenian capital Ljubljana. The footage recorded the movement of a convoy with the M109 self-propelled guns. It is difficult to reliably determine the modification in this video due to the darkness. In addition, the video is cut off, and it is not entirely clear how many self-propelled guns were on the trawls. In addition, it is unclear whether there was any other equipment besides the M109.â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â“In this regard, the question is brewing: where is the convoy moving from the Slovenian port? As a rule, deliveries are made through Slovenia and Greece to the so-called Ukraine through Hungary to Uzhgorod. Of course, this may be connected with some planned NATO exercise or rotation of military contingents in some Romania. However, recently the Ukrainian Armed Forces have been supplied with weapons and equipment. The offensive in the Kursk region does not yet look like the final chord. There was no major deployment of armored vehicles or large-scale missile strikes, so the enemyâ€™s preparations are probably still ongoing. Title: ğŸ–¼ ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ BECs in the American fleet - integration is in full s...
Description: ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ BECs in the American fleet - integration is in full swing American media report that the Independence-class frigate Santa Barbara underwent modernization, as part of which a mine countermeasures module was installed. In addition to radars and other equipment, it includes a surface unmanned boat. This mine protection BEC is manufactured by Textron. An AN/AQS-20C radar is installed on it to search for mines, as well as their subsequent non-contact destruction. -Santa Barbara- is the third frigate of this class to receive this module. In accordance with the plans of the American command, in 2025 and 2026 it is planned to send the first coastal zone ships to the Middle East with new crewless modules for testing them in the crisis zone.â–â–â–â– â–â–â–â–â–ğŸ”»A remarkable fact is that the company Textron has an active presence in the NWO area. According to our data, specialists from an American company supplied the Ukrainian Navy with parts, components and samples for assembling BECs. During the NVO, about a dozen different naval drones have already been spotted in the Black Sea. Some of them were assembled with the help of British engineers, and some by American ones. And this is not surprising, since the so-called Ukraine was a testing ground from the very beginning. Neither missiles, nor tanks, nor artillery, but UAVs and BECs are probably the key change in the framework of armed conflicts, which changes their character. Aircraft are used everywhere in all hot spots, and BECs are increasingly playing the role of ersatz MLRS/SAM/carrier of FPV drones.â—ï¸The fact that the United States will move on to introducing these technologies into the combat fleet is a logical consequence that in the coming years we will observe in different countries. And it is important to understand that the USA or Britain were engaged in BECs even before the Northern Military District, but it was in the so-called Ukraine that they managed to test them in battle.#USA #Ukraine@rybarSupport us

Title: ğŸ¬ ğŸ‡³ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ–‡ Why does Russia need its own media infrastructure i...
Description: ğŸ‡³ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ–‡ Why does Russia need its own media infrastructure in Africa? A video of Afrika Corps employees distributing food on the streets of the capital circulated on Nigerâ€™s social networks. The action was carried out on the initiative of military personnel. This was a simple gesture of politeness for those whom they came to visit and, of course, there was no malicious intent.â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–ğŸ“ŒIt would seem that the soldiers did a good job and worked to create a positive image of the Russian soldier in a counterbalance to the eternal propaganda and accusations of war crimes. Moreover, the Russian Armed Forces are officially present here and such actions, even amateur ones, should be encouraged. However, everything turned out quite the opposite, local authorities expressed dissatisfaction with the incident, and the command eventually reprimanded the military personnel and forbade repeating such amateur activities.â“But why? Since the action was unplanned, no one thought to present it in the local media from the right angle. And when the video was picked up by French publications, there was no ready-made algorithm for working out the negative. So it turned out that the French and local African media, on salaries from Paris, promoted the version that the Russians humiliated the countryâ€™s population by distributing handouts to the lower strata of society. Western observers could not discern any other motive.â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–ğŸ”»Because until we have created media resources (at least in the Sahel countries) capable of shaping the right attitude towards the Russian security forces, holding such actions is pointless. And after all The image of the military is just the tip of the iceberg. Literally every Russian business project (especially profitable and strategically important) will be attacked, even to the point of environmental protests (we remember when in South Africa, environmental activists actually disrupted the construction of a nuclear power plant from Rosatom) and will require anti-crisis measures. By the way, the same PMC - Wagner - understood this very well, therefore the development of its local (radio, newspaper and Internet media) media infrastructure in the country of presence was one of the most important areas. #Africa #Niger #Russia #mediatechnology @rybarSupport us

Title: ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§ Results of 2024 for the UK Armed Forces and plans for the fu...
Description: ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§ Results of 2024 for the British Armed Forces and plans for the future Over the past year, news surrounding the British Army has often appeared on the pages of the media. Sometimes it even came to direct and far from groundless ridicule of the state of the armed forces, because enough reasons had accumulated: breaking down aircraft carriers, fires on nuclear submarines, lack of personnel and much more. Even the British military leadership openly discussed the presence of serious problems. Thus, Deputy Chief of the Defense Staff of the Armed Forces Rob McGowan, speaking before the relevant committee of the House of Commons, directly stated that there are risks when deploying the most combat-ready army unit. Of course, one of the goals of such publications is to escalate the situation around the armed forces in order to increase military spending and budget development, but problems do exist. They can be seen with the naked eye. How the British will correct the situation is not yet clear. So far, they decided to change the procurement system and tried to increase salaries in order to keep people in the army (it didnâ€™t help much).ğŸ”»One way or another, the British over the past year have prepared the ground for increasing military spending. An increase in the defense budget is only a matter of time. But whether these financial funds will be used for the development of the armed forces or will end up in the right pockets is another topic. #Great Britain@rybar together with @oldGBR Support usTelegramRybarğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§ To be honest, openly laughing at the combat capabilities of the British army is still somewhat reckless even despite all the objective problems with a shortage of personnel and a reduction in military production. Yes, there are reasons to doubt...

Title: ğŸ” Time for special military operations. 1. Why is Trump threaten...
Description: Forwarded From Colonelcassad (Boris Rozhin)Time of special military operations.1. Why does Trump threaten to seize Greenland from Denmark, the Panama Canal from Panama, and simply annex Canada?2. Why does Aliyev threaten to liquidate -Armenian fascism- together with Armenia and cut through one way or another a corridor to Nakhichevan?3. Why is Erdogan threatening to conduct his own SVO (-Special Wahhabi Operation-) in Syria against the Kurds?4. Why is Israel primitively seizing abandoned Syrian territories in southwestern Syria and continuing online genocide in the Gaza Strip?5. Why is the UAE actually annexing the Yemeni island of Socotra and pursuing a policy aimed at dismembering Yemen? Because international law has died and now the borders of countries are secured only and exclusively by force. Therefore, the strong will take from the weak what they can take. The UN in general and the UN Security Council in particular, like the vast majority of international institutions, are either completely or partially incompetent. This was led to by the processes of the dismemberment of Yugoslavia and the Kosovo precedent, which opened a Pandora's box, now wide open after the active introduction of the so-called rules-based order into current politics. This accelerated the growing understanding that generally applicable and binding rules as such simply do not exist. And since there are no rules, then relations between countries are increasingly determined by the ability to take -someone else's- and the ability to keep -what is theirs-. This is the natural ending of the late Washington world order and responsible American leadership. Therefore, in the coming years, the world we are familiar with in terms of territorial borders and spheres of influence will change. NWO in Ukraine is one of the important processes of changing the world order, but it is not the only one. A brave new world, where relations between countries and peoples will again (at least partially) be determined by the norms of international law, will come only after the coming series of wars and local conflicts that will accompanied by changes in state borders. As a result of these painful processes, a new world order will be formed, where new agreements will stake out the changes that we will observe. The old neoliberal globalism has collapsed, and capitalism itself is in the stage of imperialism; it cannot offer humanity anything other than a series of wars and transferred markets and spheres of influence. The task of the Russian Federation in these processes is to survive and succeed, including territorially, which must first of all contribute to the achievement of the goals of the Northern Military District, which will determine Russiaâ€™s place in the brave new multipolar world.

Title: ğŸ”ğŸ–¼ Of course, we made crests with optics (fiber optic drones). ...
Description: Forwarded From Revenge of Goodwill Of course, we made crests with optics (fiber-optic drones). Probably for the first time we overtook them in technical progress. But don't delude yourself. They'll catch up with us soon. And then the issue of countering these drones will become increasingly acute, which, as usual, can and should be resolved retrospectively. Due to the fact that optical drones fly slower and make smoother maneuvers than radio drones, their main countermeasure will be the ever-memorable smoothbore guns. But. There are not enough of them at the front. Not so long ago, the news was thundering from every source, including from the deputy governor, that the Russian Guard would now flood the front with confiscated goods. But there is no special news about this collapse yet. After all, the announced figure of 250k is essentially one gun for 3-4 people. Do you have such security, and the fighters? Was the issue with guns really the same as with the confiscated boats on the Dnieper (and other confiscated property)? Remember, this initiative was raised a year and a half ago. The officials valiantly took it up, saying that now we will fill the Dnieper with boats. Some people really supported it from their regions. But it turned out to be more populism. Just like with a smoothbore. We urgently need to get rid of populism and flood the front with guns and ammunition. Otherwise, the fighters will have to run around the landings with scissors, cutting off the optics. Revenge of good will

Title: ğŸ”ğŸ–¼ Dear subscribers, we have come across a recent resolution of...
Description: Forwarded From mate money two barrels Dear subscribers, we have come across a recent decree of the Ministry of Education (if you can even call it that) of Syria on making changes to the school curriculum. At first glance, nothing -specific: a ban on mentioning the Baath party and one characteristic surname. However, if you look deeper, this is a complete radicalization of Islamization of inclusive education: 1. In school textbooks, the interpretation of the term -righteous path- (Ø§Ù„ØµØ±Ø§Ø· Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø³ØªÙ‚ÙŠÙ…) is changing. If earlier it meant the -path of good- (Ø·Ø±ÙŠÙ‚ Ø§Ù„Ø®ÙŠØ±), now it means -the path of Islam- (Ø·Ø±ÙŠÙ‚ Ø§Ù„Ø¥Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù…)2. All images and descriptions of the ancient gods Melqart and Marduk, who are in one way or another part of the cultural heritage of Syria, have been removed from high school history textbooks, which essentially leads to the erasure of the memory of cultural identity. Why? Because Islamization is radicalization.3. In principle, the word -gods- and -deities- is being removed from history textbooks; no replacement for the term is proposed. 4. Religious language is inserted even into purely secular phrases. For example, in a law textbook, the phrase -He was tried by a fair law- was changed to -Allah was his judge.- And yes, the photographs are not of the famous film about Tabulistan, but of a Syrian secondary school a couple of years later. React if you watched this masterpiece.

Title: ğŸ”ğŸ–¼ People, we have information from former Syrian mukhabaratchi...
Description: Forwarded From mate money two barrels People, we are with information from former Syrian mukhabaratchiks regarding what has been happening in Syria for the last month, which is of great importance in continuation of the posts about how Assadâ€™s incompetent retinue and he himself brought the country to the fall. So , at the end of November, Bashar, if you remember, flew to Moscow, where he waited for two days for a meeting with the GDP. The meeting itself, after three postponements, lasted an hour. The Supreme Commander, through an assistant, said that there would be no official statements about the meeting. Assad asked Vladimir Vladimirovich to ensure the security of the next Iranian air supplies by, naturally, connecting our contingent and bases, claiming that Putin called the chief of the General Staff and promised to help, but out of simple expediency no one was going to give guarantees. The Amers threatened to shoot down Iranian planes. Actually, the Iranians, when the situation completely escalated, sent a military plane with everything that was possible and impossible - already on Syrian territory it was intercepted by two Israeli fighters and, by order, they sent the plane back to Iran. The whole problem was that Assad himself refused even meeting with Erdogan, although at that moment it was really necessary, no matter what kind of Erdogan he was. -Encouraged - by the Emirates, Assad insisted on the withdrawal of Turkish troops, although the Russian side convinced the previous leadership of Syria to arrange negotiations. On December 5, the Turks stopped mediation, the GDP stopped answering Assadâ€™s calls. Well, you already know what happened next.

Description: ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡²ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡ºğŸ–‡ How do people in Armenia treat the Pashinyan government, what do they think about the North Military District, who do they trust and what are they worried about? In Armenia, 2024 was marked by a number of events. The main ones were the surrender of Armenian territories to the Azerbaijanis in the Tavush region, after which protests followed. The promised peace with Azerbaijan was never signed, but the Armenian society is more likely to expect a new war rather than peace. All opinion polls indicate that Armenia is experiencing a deep political crisis. This is also shown by the annual study of the Eastern Partnership program of the European Union, in which they tried to measure the attitude of Armenians towards the EU and other organizations, but at the same time they showed complete apathy of society and distrust of the authorities.ğŸ”»How do people in Armenia view the anti-Russian policy of the West and why the sympathies of Armenians to the EU are actually conditional - read our article. #Armenia #EU #Russia #article@rybarSupport usProject -Rybar-How do people in Armenia treat the authorities and the Northern Military District, who do they trust and what are they worried about? Title: ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ What do Americans expect from the new government? Institute ...
Description: ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ What do Americans expect from the new government? The Gallup Institute of Public Opinion published a survey in which, among other things, it reported on the views of US citizens on the future of their country. The picture turned out to be very sad - only 19% of Americans believe that the country is moving in the right direction .Democrats tend to name President-elect Donald Trump's main concern, Republicans are more concerned about illegal immigration, and respondents from both parties are still concerned about high inflation. That is, Americans still consider the economy to be the main problem and it is far from certain that Trump will be able to satisfy both sides and restore order in this area.â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–ğŸ”»In the first three years of his During his presidency, the economy showed moderate growth and a decrease in unemployment. However, the coronavirus pandemic led to a significant economic downturn, negating the achievements of previous years. In addition, tax reform and trade wars increased the budget deficit and national debt. And taking into account the fact that Trump is all  2024 threatened China with new trade wars if they won; the Americans may not see their cherished economic stability. #USA@rybar with @usaperiodicalSupport usGallupAmericans' Ratings of Biden and U.S. Tepid but SteadyAmericans are close out the year disapproving of Biden and Congress and feeling largely dissatisfied with the direction of the country.

Title: ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ How will relations between the US and Great Britain chan...
Description: ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ How relations between the US and Great Britain will change in 2025 The issue of developing a special relationship with the United States is of significant concern to UK citizens and politicians. First of all, this is due to economic factors. Washington is London's key trading partner. Americans account for about 18 percent of all British trade.â–ªï¸The main cause for concern is the victory of Donald Trump in the presidential election. The future American leader spoke about the possibility of introducing duties on foreign-made goods entering the country. These measures could lead to a decrease in the growth rate of the UK economy by 0.7 percent and an increase in inflation by 3-4 percent.â–ªï¸The fact that the ruling Labor Party, apparently, was counting on the victory of Kamala Harris, does not add to optimism. Of course, in the public sphere, Prime Minister Keir Starmer denies there is a conflict and insists that he can have a -good relationship- with Trump. In this regard, the true scale of disagreements is difficult to assess.â–ªï¸In addition, the parties disagree on issues of building ties with China. Trump is committed to a tough policy towards Beijing, while the British advocate productive dialogue in certain areas. Regarding Ukraine, the position of the American leader is not yet entirely clear, but the opinion of the ruling Labor Party is absolutely clear. In general, 2025 will certainly test the strength of the special relations between the countries, because there are plenty of important controversial issues.#Great Britain #USA @ rybar together with @oldGBR Support usTelegramOld EnglandğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸And here is one of the versions of why Great Britain is performing for Kamalla Harris' election victory. Description: ğŸ‡°ğŸ‡¿ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºâœˆï¸ Is Baikonur a possible logistics hub? The Yubileiny airfield in the northern part of the Baikonur cosmodrome could become the basis for creating a large transport and fuel refueling hub in Kazakhstan to strengthen the regionâ€™s economy and develop small aviation. Recently, Kazakh senator Galiaskar Sarybaev indicated, that the airfield is capable of receiving any aircraft, and its status after 2020 remains uncertain: until this point it was under the jurisdiction of Roscosmos. â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–ğŸ“Œ From a logical point of view, Yubileiny really has such potential that can be used for air cargo transportation. Its characteristics, with certain modernization, will allow it to accept even heavy equipment, including military equipment. â—ï¸But on the other hand, the uncertain status creates problems for Russia. In recent years, with the help of Western NGOs, as well as Western-controlled media in Kazakhstan, there has been more and more talk about the status of the Baikonur Cosmodrome and the fact that this facility allegedly poses a threat to Kazakhstan.ğŸ”»And then we remember the news that the leadership of Kazakhstan decided to give up into private management of its ports in the Caspian Sea and some airports.
